meanings.definition: To break down food in the stomach for absorption into the body.
meanings.sent1: My stomach digests the food I eat to give me energy.
meanings.sent2: The stomach digests the pizza quickly.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if my stomach digests food faster when I'm hungry.
meanings.sent4: Her stomach digests food like a powerful machine.
meanings.sent5: The way the stomach digests food is truly amazing.

meanings.definition: A compilation or summary of information.
meanings.sent1: The book contains a digest of all the important events of the year.
meanings.sent2: I read the digest to catch up on the latest news.
meanings.sent3: The digest of the meeting was surprisingly short.
meanings.sent4: Her mind works like a digest, organizing information neatly.
meanings.sent5: The digest provided a quick overview of the topic.

meanings.sent1: She digests new concepts quickly and easily.
meanings.sent2: I need some time to digest all the information in this report.
meanings.sent3: I can't believe how fast she can digest complex ideas.
meanings.sent4: Her mind digests knowledge like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: He digests information like a computer processing data.
